metadata.subject: PROPOSAL: Poetry in America for Middle and High School Teachers

relationships.description: Collaborating on Poetry in America project
Alternative funding channel for the project

analysis.purpose: To secure funding for Poetry in America educational program for teachers
analysis.significance: Proposal for a major educational initiative involving Harvard and numerous high-profile figures to create poetry education content for teachers and students

notable_quotes: Poetry in America, a collaboration between Elisa New and Programs in Professional Education (PPE) at the Harvard Graduate School of Education (HGSE), will produce courses for national and international distribution to K-12 teachers.
Teachers will be able to use to this course to strengthen their classroom practice while accumulating credits toward advanced degrees in education.
Funds to support Poetry in America for Middle and High School Teachers may be directed to the Harvard Graduate School of Education.

blackmail_indicators.description: No indicators of blackmail or coercion found in this educational funding proposal

illegal_activity.description: No illegal activity mentioned or suggested in this educational proposal document

public_knowledge.context: This appears to be a legitimate educational proposal involving Harvard University and numerous public figures for poetry education initiatives

analysis.summary: A funding proposal for Poetry in America, an educational collaboration between Elisa New and Harvard Graduate School of Education to create professional development courses for K-12 teachers using poetry content featuring numerous high-profile public figures and celebrities, with funding options through Harvard or Filmmaker's Collaborative.
